channel.title: Class26s on COM402 Advanced Web Design
channel.description: Recent content in Class26s on COM402 Advanced Web Design

item.title: Friday, March 24, 2017
item.description:
Chapter X

Assignments for Next Week

Class will not be held next week, but I would like you to keep up with your education. I have some assignments; everything is due before class on Monday of next week. This will count towards your in class / participation work.

item.title: Assignment 1 - Dark Patterns
item.description:
We’ve learned a little bit about UI and UX. Sometimes, learning what is good web design is easy when you learn about bad web design.

Read

  • http://www.theverge.com/2013/8/29/4640308/dark-patterns-inside-the-interfaces-designed-to-trick-you
  • https://www.fastcodesign.com/3066586/the-year-dark-patterns-won
  • https://www.usertesting.com/blog/2015/10/01/dark-patterns-the-sinister-side-of-ux/

Explore

  • https://darkpatterns.org/

Respond

Over the next week, as you navigate the web take note of some dark patterns that you find. Email me a 150-200 word response to tell me about what you have experienced, answering the following questions:

  1. Why do you think the company has implemented this?
  2. What would YOU do differently?

item.title: Assignment 2 - Javascript30 - 1
item.description:
We’ve been working with Javascript and jQuery - here is a great set of tutorials for Javascript!

Sign Up

Sign up for an account at Javascript 30

Complete

Complete the first lesson (day one, the drum kit)

Respond

Send me your completed file(s) (zip is fine!), with a 100ish word response about your experience.

  1. Did you like learning via a video tutorial?
  2. How could you use what you learned in this tutorial to create something different?

item.title: Assignment 3 - Javascript30 - 3
item.description:
Once you’ve completed Day 1 of Javascript 30, you can skip day 2 (woah, we’re rebels!) and go right to Day 3. We’re skipping day 2 because we already made a clock together, but if you want to review or want to see how HE did it, feel free to follow.

Complete

Complete the third lesson (day three, the playing with variables in CSS)

Respond

Send me your completed file(s) (zip is fine!), with a 100ish word response about your experience.

  1. Did you like learning via a video tutorial?
  2. How could you use what you learned in this tutorial to create something different?

item.title: Consuming an API using jQuery
item.description:
Let’s work together to consume an API using jQuery.

A few points to cover

  1. What is an API?
  2. What type of response might we get from an api?
  3. What is JSON?
  4. How do we get data from an API using AJAX?

Build Together

-Giphy API -Quotes API example
